pageContent:
Business Associate 
Integrity@Genpact 
 
Guide to our Policies

Genpact Business Associate Integrity Policy Introduction     
 
It is important to understand Genpact’s unwavering commitment to integrity, compliance with 
law and ethical business practices.  Genpact always does business the right way, and expects 
its alliance partners, suppliers, vendors and other third parties to also follow the same path.  In 
this direction, Genpact has now decided to re-launch this Policy–document which sheds light on 
the way Genpact expects the companies it does business with to conduct themselves while 
working on Genpact contracts and assignments. 
This Policy shall be applicable to all third parties acting for or on behalf of Genpact, such as 
alliance partners, consultants, agents, contractors and vendors (“Business Associates”).  All 
Business Associates must agree to follow applicable Genpact Policies. 
Each Policy lays down the basic policy statement and then a list of responsibilities applicable to

Business Associates must agree to follow applicable Genpact Policies. 
Each Policy lays down the basic policy statement and then a list of responsibilities applicable to 
all Business Associates.  No policy is complete without a framework for its enforcement, hence 
the last section is devoted to Raising Concerns. 
All the policies are equally important and have the same relevance for every Genpact Business 
Associate irrespective of the nature of their work or their geographical location.  It is important 
for every Business Associate to assimilate the message behind these guidelines and ensure the 
strictest compliance in every aspect of their conduct. 
Principles 
1.  Obey Laws and Regulations 
 
Ensure that all applicable laws are obeyed at all levels.  If in doubt, seek clarifications 
from Genpact. 
 
2. Respect Confidentiality 
To emphasize the significance of protecting Genpact’s information (including information

from Genpact. 
 
2. Respect Confidentiality 
To emphasize the significance of protecting Genpact’s information (including information 
of Genpact’s clients and their customers, which for the purposes of this Guide is 
considered Genpact confidential information) and the consequences of any violation, 
which requires keeping abreast with all legal requirements regarding data protection 
laws and Genpact policies and business privacy.  Keep secure the business records 
dealing with Genpact and its customers as well as all other Genpact information 
classified as confidential, including computer based information, drawings, designs, etc. 
 
3. Safeguard Genpact Assets 
 
To establish a principle to protect all Genpact assets that the Business Associate uses, 
has access to or creates in the course of its performance for Genpact.  Examples 
include Genpact’s corporate image, reputation and goodwill.  Cautions against disclosing

has access to or creates in the course of its performance for Genpact.  Examples 
include Genpact’s corporate image, reputation and goodwill.  Cautions against disclosing 
and ensures protection of Genpact proprietary information that is not publicly known or 
generally available to anyone outside without consulting Genpact and against misusing

Genpact resources, intellectual property, time or facilities (including office equipment, 
email and computer applications) for personal gain. 
 
4. Avoid even the appearance of impropriety 
 
To sensitize its employees regarding all situations that can create a potential conflict of 
interest.  Ensure that its employees, in performing services for Genpact, are aware of the 
importance of avoiding even the appearance of impropriety, in both their personal as 
well as professional lives, so that they do not even inadvertently come close to crossing 
the line. 
 
5. No Community, Gender or Race Discrimination 
To encourage professionalism at all levels, make decisions on the merits and to prohibit 
any discrimination or prejudice based on gender, community, race, color, region or 
religion. 
 
Laws and Regulations 
Business Associates shall follow all applicable laws and also rules and regulations defined by

religion. 
 
Laws and Regulations 
Business Associates shall follow all applicable laws and also rules and regulations defined by 
Genpact from time to time to ensure complete compliance to the law to ensure fair business 
practices, including requiring such compliance from Business Associates’ vendors throughout its 
supply chain. 
 Follow lawful business practices and comply with Central/Federal, State and Local Laws, 
rules and regulations and the terms and conditions of its contract with Genpact. 
 Follow the applicable tax laws, and shall not criminally evade payment of tax nor take 
any act to facilitate the criminal evasion of tax of tax by others.  
 Follow Genpact policies related to Environment, Health and Safety, Integrity, etc. 
 Follow statutory laws and regulations related to payment of wages, minimum wages, 
equal pay for equal work, etc. 
 Should not employ workers below the age of 14 years for providing services.

 Follow statutory laws and regulations related to payment of wages, minimum wages, 
equal pay for equal work, etc. 
 Should not employ workers below the age of 14 years for providing services. 
 Should not employ human slaves, trafficked persons, forced, prison or indentured labor 
or workers subject to any form of coercion. 
 Should not indulge in any unlawful or unethical activity. 
 
Privacy 
Business Associates shall protect all confidential and personal information that it accesses, 
creates, receives, maintains or otherwise uses on behalf of Genpact, its clients or its 
employees.  It is the duty of each Business Associates to protect such confidential and personal 
information and other sensitive data from inappropriate or unauthorized use or disclosure. 
Business Associates shall only obtain, use and access confidential or personal information in 
accordance with law and with its contract with Genpact.  The data so collected must be relevant

Business Associates shall only obtain, use and access confidential or personal information in 
accordance with law and with its contract with Genpact.  The data so collected must be relevant 
and not excessive keeping in mind the purpose for which such data is collected and maintained

and shall be retained for only as long as is required.  Failure to do so could carry serious legal 
implications.  In case of any doubt, please contact Genpact. Confidential and personal 
information means information that cannot be shared without prior authorization and is classified 
as confidential, either by law, by Genpact or by a Genpact customer, and includes, by way of 
example and not by way of limitation: 
 Name, address, telephone number and/or email address or any other information about 
an individual together with the individual’s name 
 An individual’s medical information 
 An individual’s financial records 
 Family information from or about an individual 
 Information regarding an individual’s racial or ethnic origin, political opinions or 
affiliations, religious or philosophical beliefs, union membership, data concerning health 
or sexual preference.  
 
Conflicts of Interest

affiliations, religious or philosophical beliefs, union membership, data concerning health 
or sexual preference.  
 
Conflicts of Interest 
Ensure Business Associate employees deployed at Genpact disclose all financial and other 
business interests that may be in conflict with their performance of their services for Genpact.  
Business Associates must not use Genpact’s resources or influence or Genpact’s name for 
promoting their business activities without prior and specific written approval from Genpact. 
The following can create potential conflicts of interest: 
 Using Genpact proprietary information (such as templates, process maps, etc.) in an 
outside business or consulting activity or in an activity for a Business Associate that is 
not for Genpact 
 Using Genpact facilities, equipment, e-mail, or computer applications for an outside 
business or consulting activity or in an activity for a Business Associate that is not for 
Genpact

 Using Genpact facilities, equipment, e-mail, or computer applications for an outside 
business or consulting activity or in an activity for a Business Associate that is not for 
Genpact 
 Using Genpact’s name or resources to promote or assist an outside business or in an 
activity for a Business Associate that is not for Genpact 
 Offering gifts of a value to Genpact employees to influence or appear to influence 
Genpact’s decisions of purchase, award or supervision of contract. 
 Offering personal discounts or other benefits not available to the general public or 
similarly situated Genpact employees. 
 
Intellectual Property 
Genpact’s intellectual property is one of its most valuable assets.  It is Genpact’s policy to 
establish, protect, maintain and defend its rights in all intellectual property and to use those 
rights in legally responsible ways.  Genpact respects the valid intellectual property rights of

establish, protect, maintain and defend its rights in all intellectual property and to use those 
rights in legally responsible ways.  Genpact respects the valid intellectual property rights of 
others.  Business Associates shall use Genpact’s Intellectual Property only for the purpose of 
providing services to Genpact.  Business Associates shall preserve and maintain confidentiality 
relating to any information which is confidential and proprietary from Genpact’s perspective or 
from Genpact’s customer’s perspective.  Business Associates should not use third party 
intellectual property unless it has the proper licenses for providing services to Genpact.

Controllership  
Controllership comprises four factors that are vital to Genpact’s unyielding commitment to 
transparency: 
 Integrity of records 
 Strict adherence to business processes 
 Integrity in communications 
 Preservation of documents and records 
Business Associates shall maintain controllership at all times in performance of its services for 
Genpact. 
 
Improper Payments 
Genpact must not authorize, involve itself in, or tolerate any business practice that allows 
improper payments.  A violation of the Policy can result in severe civil and criminal penalties, 
under applicable laws on more than one count. 
 Business Associates should not give or receive anything of value, including cash, to/from 
any Genpact employee or government official or party in order to obtain any advantage 
in selling goods or services, or conducting financial transactions in connection with the 
services provided to Genpact. 
 
Safe Work Environment

in selling goods or services, or conducting financial transactions in connection with the 
services provided to Genpact. 
 
Safe Work Environment 
Genpact is committed to creating a safe work environment, keeping in mind the interests of 
Genpact, Business Associates and their employees/representatives as well as those of the 
community at large.  Business Associates will strive to provide safe and healthy working 
conditions and encourage work practices that respect the environment and the communities in 
which it does business.  The Genpact Safe Work Environment Policy is proactive in nature, 
anticipating possible risks that might come up at the level of employees as well as the 
environment. 
 Familiarize all employees with emergency procedures, for example, in case of fire, 
injuries, earthquakes or illness. 
 Learn how to reduce the use and release of toxic and hazardous materials, prevent 
pollution, and conserve, recover and recycle materials.

injuries, earthquakes or illness. 
 Learn how to reduce the use and release of toxic and hazardous materials, prevent 
pollution, and conserve, recover and recycle materials. 
 Do not indulge in, nor be under the influence of alcohol or other intoxicants and narcotics 
while at work.   
 Eliminate unreasonable workplace health and safety risks from Genpact’s facilities, 
products, services and activities. 
 Keep a look out for potential health and safety hazards. 
 Contribute towards maintaining hygienic working conditions within Genpact premises or 
extended facilities.

 Pay special attention to conservation of natural resources, including water, energy.  
Recover and recycle materials in routine business practices. 
 
Fair Employment Practices 
Genpact is committed to Fair Employment Practices, including the prohibition against all forms 
of discrimination – based on age, race, community, color, region, religion and gender.  Genpact 
is committed to observing all applicable labor and employment laws wherever it operates, and 
expects the same of its Business Associates at every tier.  That includes observing those laws 
that pertain to privacy, the prohibition of forced, compulsory and child labor, and those laws that 
pertain to the elimination of any improper employment discrimination.  Respect individuals, 
make decisions based on merit and always maintain and promote peace and harmony at the 
workplace. 
 Workplace Harassment is a prohibited form of discrimination under this Policy and

make decisions based on merit and always maintain and promote peace and harmony at the 
workplace. 
 Workplace Harassment is a prohibited form of discrimination under this Policy and 
includes harassment based on an individual’s sex, race, religion, community, national 
origin, sexual orientation, disability, age, etc. 
 Harassment can take many forms such as (a) direct or indirect, unwelcome verbal or 
physical conduct directed against a fellow employee or third party (e.g., customer or 
Business Associate); (b) distributing or posting (electronically or otherwise) hate 
literature; (c) making fun of or defaming a member of a particular religion, race, sex etc.  
These incidents may take place through the use of inappropriate stereotypes, telling 
offensive jokes, use of ethnic slurs or taking other actions which have the purpose or 
effect of unreasonably interfering with an individual’s work performance or creating an 
intimidating, hostile or offensive work environment.

effect of unreasonably interfering with an individual’s work performance or creating an 
intimidating, hostile or offensive work environment. 
 Sexual Harassment is a specific form of work place harassment which includes 
unwelcome sexually determined behavior (whether directly or indirectly), including 
physical contact and advances or demands or requests for sexual favors, sexually 
colored remarks, showing pornography, any other uncomfortable physical, verbal, or 
non-verbal conduct of a sexual nature where submission or rejection of such conduct by 
an individual is used as the basis for employment decisions affecting the individual or 
interfering with the individual’s work performance or creating an intimidating, hostile, 
unprofessional or offensive working environment.  The same would be equally applicable 
to individuals irrespective of whether they are drawing salary, honorarium or are 
voluntary workers or work for Business Associates.

Raising Concerns 
 
Any concerns or issues shall be raised to 
VP Sourcing,  and VP, Global Compliance or ombudsperson@genpact.com  
When raising an issue, please remember to include the following: name of vendor, country, 
city and building where working 
Genpact

Integrity Commitment 
The undersigned (“Business Associate”) hereby acknowledges and agrees for the benefit of 
GENPACT (“GENPACT”): 
1.  Business Associate has been provided a copy of the GENPACT Business Associate 
Integrity@Genpact Guide (the “Guide”) 
2. Senior management (including the undersigned representative) of the Business 
Associate has carefully reviewed the Guide. 
3. Business Associate has reviewed the Guide with its Suppliers and subcontractors, if 
any. 
4. Business Associate and its employees or representatives, as well as suppliers and 
subcontractors of Business Associate, if any, are committed to unyielding integrity and 
agree/have agreed to comply with the Integrity standards as set forth in the Guide, 
including as they relate to Business Associate’s dealings with Genpact, any goods or 
services being provided, conveyed or sold by Business Associate to GENPACT or any 
work being performed by Business Associate for or on behalf of GENPACT.

services being provided, conveyed or sold by Business Associate to GENPACT or any 
work being performed by Business Associate for or on behalf of GENPACT.  
5. These obligations and undertakings of Business Associate are in addition to and do not 
modify or amend any obligations or commitments of Business Associate in any 
GENPACT purchase order or other written agreements between the parties. 
Acknowledged and agreed to by Business Associate on
